task.title: Configure AEM to Use Livefyre
task.shortdesc: Configure AEM to use your organization’s Livefyre license credentials.

step.cmd: Find your organization’s Livefyre credentials. Open Livefyre Studio, and go to Settings > Integration Settings > Credentials, to access the following information:
Configure AEM to use this Livefyre Network and Site by creating one or more Livefyre Cloud Service Configurations.

substep.cmd: From the AEM Dashboard, go to Tools > Deployment > Cloud Services.
Click Configure now or Show Configurations (depending on your AEM platform).
Click the plus sign (+) next to Available Configurations to create a Livefyre Configuration.
Complete the information. For more on how to complete the information for Livefyre in AEM Cloud Services, see the Cloud Services Documentation for AEM on docs.adobe.com.

step.cmd: When the Livefyre Network Configuration form displays, enter the Network Domain, Network Key, Site ID, and Site Key you obtained from Studio, and click OK.
step.info: If your AEM Publish and AEM Author do not share the same cryptographic key you may need to repeat this process on the publisher instances. This is because the Network Key and Site Key are encrypted. For more information, see Replicate the Crypto Key on docs.adobe.com.

taskbody.result: You’ve now created a Livefyre Cloud Service configuration using your Livefyre license. You can create more than one configuration if needed. For example, if you wish to use a different Livefyre Site for each of the websites hosted by your AEM installation.
